pullRequest.body:
Given a `SMul R V` instance, we introduce `HahnModule Γ R V` as an alias for HahnSeries Γ V, and produce a `SMul (HahnSeries Γ R) (HahnModule Γ R V)` instance.  We use the `SMul` instance to shorten the `Mul` instance.  We will work our way up to `Module (HahnSeries Γ R) (HahnModule Γ R V)` in a later PR.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Thanks :tada:

bors merge

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7895239611/job/21547298073)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7895239611/job/21547297780)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7895239611/job/21547297455)

Looking again, I guess my objection unfortunately extends to the entire PR. SMul only really works if you promise to only create instances of the form `SMul R S -> SMul R (F S)`, and never to create instances of the form `SMul R S -> SMul (F R) (F S)`,

This instance is a risky one, because if `V` is itself `HahnSeries Γ R` then there are two different actions.
This is the same as the reason why having `R[X]` act on `A[X]` is a bad idea, because then `R[X]` has two different actions on `R[X][X]` written the same way. I think it would probably be best not to have this instance, to match what we do with polynomials.
I see. I tried making a type alias, like in `Mathlib.Data.Polynomial.Module`.
I think it would be good to have all of this in a `namespace HahnModule`. Could you please refactor the file a bit to make this possible?
Sure.  Since this file is approaching 2000 lines, I was thinking of making a `HahnSeries` folder and splitting it up a bit (in another PR).  Does that sound reasonable?
Sounds good

Now that it is namespaced, I hope we can get rid of the `''`.
```suggestion
theorem add_coeff [SMul R V] {x y : HahnModule Γ R V} {a : Γ} :
```

I think every declaration in this namespace assumes `[SMul R V]`. Some other variables also occur a lot. Can you please see if you can move some of these "background assumptions" to this `variable` line?
It looks like `[SMul R V]` doesn't like to be mixed with `[SMulWithZero R V]` or `[SMulZeroClass R V]`, so I changed the `V` to `W` in the later results.

You should be able to just copy across the other instance rather than building it from scratch

bors r-

bors d+
That looks great!  Thanks for fixing it!
Should this be marked reducible, because it's now used to define the `[NonUnitalNonAssocSemiring R] : Mul (HahnSeries Γ R)` instance?
That sounds like it might be a good idea (but I don't know enough to judge).  I'll try putting it in #10846, which is still open.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: HahnModule action by HahnSeries
